title: debuginfo: Could not find scope info for node NodeExpr(expr(25180: !0 as u32))

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

body:
<short summary of the bug>
I tried this code:

``` rust
pub type LcoreId = u32;

pub const LCORE_ID_ANY: LcoreId = u32::MAX;

/// Return the index of the lcore starting from zero.
pub fn index(lcore_id: LcoreId) -> Option<LcoreId> {
    match lcore_id {
        LCORE_ID_ANY => id(),
        0...ffi::RTE_MAX_LCORE => {
            Some(unsafe { ffi::lcore_config[lcore_id as usize].core_index as u32 })
        }
        _ => None,
    }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: <explanation>

> code could be compiled.

Instead, this happened: <explanation>

> compiler crashed.

If we use `!0 as u32` instead of `u32::MAX`, compiler could handle it

``` rust
pub const LCORE_ID_ANY: LcoreId = !0 as u32;
```
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.9.0 (e4e8b6668 2016-05-18)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: e4e8b666850a763fdf1c3c2c142856ab51e32779
commit-date: 2016-05-18
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.9.0
```

Backtrace:
